request.description: Impersonate a Tableau User
Sign Out of Tableau
Query all data sources in the site
Query a specific data source
Deletes the specified Datasource
Downloads the specified Datasource. WARNING: Don't try to download a tdsx with POSTman. It will crash. Try downloading a tds that doesn't have a local file attached with it.
Update the DataSource's Project or Owner
Modify the serverAddress, serverPort, userName, and/or password for a specific data connection on a specific datasources
Query DataSource connection information

Note: When you make this request with Postman the content-type will be multipart/form-data and you will get an error. The only way to get it to work is to copy the request in an application like Charles or Fiddler, edit the content-type to be multipart/mixed and then it will work.

Starts a session to upload files to. Creates an empty file but subsequent calls to Append to File Upload add chunks of data to this file. This is used becaused http requests have a max size of 64mb. If your file is less than that, then it will be easier to just use Publish DataSource or Workbook. If it is bigger than that you will need to break it into chunks.

Note: When you make this request with Postman the content-type will be multipart/form-data and you will get an error. The only way to get it to work is to copy the request in an application like Charles or Fiddler, edit the content-type to be multipart/mixed and then it will work.
Returns the list of groups on the specific site, with optional parameters for paging large results

-For Local Groups, allows changing the name of the group
-For AD Groups, also syncs the groups.
Adds permissions to a specific data source.
Adds permissions to a specific workbook
Adds permissions to a specific project

body.raw:
<tsRequest> 
  <project name="myNewProj"  
    description="A new project created with the REST API" /> 
</tsRequest>

request.description: Create a new project in a specific site

body.raw:
<tsRequest> 
  <project description="A new project created with the REST API which has been UPDATED" /> 
</tsRequest>

request.description: Update an existing project in a specific site
Delete a project
Returns a list of all projects in the specified site.

body.raw:
<tsRequest>
	<site name="russell"
    contentUrl="russellSite"
    adminMode="ContentAndUsers"
    userQuota="10"
    storageQuota="40"
  disableSubscriptions="false"/>
</tsRequest>

request.description: Create a new site
Query Tableau Site by Name
View information (including storage info) about a site - similar to Query Site but with more stuff.

body.raw:
<tsRequest>
	<site name="russell"
    contentUrl="russellSite"
    adminMode="ContentAndUsers"
    userQuota="11"
    state="active"
    statusReason="Update"
    storageQuota="40"
  disableSubscriptions="false"/>
</tsRequest>

request.description: Update an existing Site

body.raw:
<tsRequest>
	<site name="russell"
    contentUrl="russellSite"
    adminMode="ContentAndUsers"
    userQuota="10"
    storageQuota="40"
  disableSubscriptions="false"/>
</tsRequest>

request.description: Returns a list of all sites on the server.

item.name: User Management: Get Users On Site

request.description: Get all users in site

item.name: User Management: Add User to Site

request.description: Add user to a site

item.name: User Management: Get Users on Site

request.description: List all the users is a specific site

item.name: User Management: Remove User from Site

request.description: Remove a specific user from a site

item.name: User Management: Query Workbooks for a User

request.description: Get a list of workbooks owned by a specific user

item.name: User Management: Add User to Group

request.description: Adds a user to the specified group.

item.name: User Management: Get Users in Group

request.description: List all the users is a specific group

item.name: User Management: Query User on Site

request.description: Returns info about the specified user

item.name: User Management: Remove User from Group

request.description: Remove a specific user from a group

Modifies information about the specified user.
If Tableau Server is configured to use local authentication, you can update the user's name, email address, password, or site role.
If Tableau Server is configured to use Active Directory for authentication, you can change the user's display name (full name), email address, and site role. However, if you synchronize the user with Active Directory, the display name and email address will be overwritten with the information that's in Active Directory.
Downloads a data source in .tds or .tdsx format.

body.raw:
<tsRequest> 
  <workbook id="efbbe45a-89ec-11e3-8e3a-1bae9933f8ef">
    <tags> 
      <tag label="Tagged by the REST API" /> 
      <tag label="tag2" />
    </tags> 
  </workbook> 
</tsRequest>

request.description: Add one or more tags to a workbook

body.raw:
<tsRequest> 
  <workbook id="efbbe45a-89ec-11e3-8e3a-1bae9933f8ef">
    <tags> 
      <tag label="Tagged by the REST API" /> 
      <tag label="tag2" />
    </tags> 
  </workbook> 
</tsRequest>

request.description: Delete a tag from the specified workbook
Get the details of a specific workbok

item.name: Query Workbook with a Preview Image

request.description: Get the details of a specific workbook, including a preview image.

body.raw:
<tsRequest> 
  <favorite label="I was Favorited by REST"> 
    <workbook id="{{workbook-id}}" /> 
  </favorite> 
</tsRequest>

request.description: Add a workbook to the favorites list of a user
Delete a workbook to the favorites list of a user
Get a preview image of a workbook's view
Get a list of views in a Workbook

item.name: Query Views for a Workbook with Usage Statistics

request.description: Get a list of views in a Workbook, including view counts
Get the thumbnail for a specific workbook
Query workbooks that the specified user has read capabilities for

body.raw:
<tsRequest> 
  <favorite label="I was Favorited by REST"> 
    <view id="ae7a0f32-7faa-4e01-86bd-803e18ca7012" /> 
  </favorite> 
</tsRequest>

request.description: Add a view to the favorites list of a user
Deletes a view from the user's favorites list.
Downloads the specified Workbook. WARNING: Don't try to download a twbx with POSTman. It will crash. Try downloading a tds that doesn't have a local file attached with it.
Lists the data connections for a specific workbook
Modify the serverAddress, serverPort, userName, and/or password for a specific data connection on a specific workbook
Update the Workbook's Project or Owner

Note: When you make this request with Postman the content-type will be multipart/form-data and you will get an error. The only way to get it to work is to copy the request in an application like Charles or Fiddler, edit the content-type to be multipart/mixed and then it will work.
